TopicTitle: Select specific mods/plugins for different games

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone, is there a way to install mods, but to use only some of them in different games?
For example, a completely stock career game with no mods, but at the same time a sandbox game in Real Solar System.

The only way (that I'm aware of) is to have two installations of KSP. It's easy to do, though: just make a copy of the KSP folder. The game locates everything relative to the directory in which the app is started, so you can have as many copies as you like (and have HDD space for).

This system also allows you to have multiple versions of the base game available. For example, I have a long-running career game (heavily modded) in 1.0.4, and a separate stock 1.0.5 installation.
I thought of that, too, unluckily this solution takes memory. Thanks.
There's a option that involves a bit of tinkering: [url]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/131214-Linux-and-maybe-OSX-Multiple-GameData-folders-for-steam-version[/url]

Install mods *outside* the KSP tree, and symbolically link them into whatever copy of KSP you're running, that way there's only one copy of a mod to manage. You can do that for most of the KSP folders also, so making a seperate game install isn't expensive in disk space. I had 8 or so different games in 0.90 & other than the base install, ironically the biggest one in disk space terms was my dev copy with very few parts in it...

^ This.
Disk space is very cheap though. My current, slightly-modded, install of 1.0.5 is 1.5Gb. Just how limited for disk space are you?
